title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:11 <@sdumitriu> abusenius: Do you have an account on hithub?  
00:12 <+abusenius> sdumitriu: yes  
00:12 <+abusenius> its abusenius  
00:15 <@sdumitriu> https://github.com/404  
00:15 <@sdumitriu> Funny

00:15 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki

11:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <+mflorea> jvelociter: without looking at the code, is it safe to assume that a live table is loaded when "xwiki-livetable-loader" is hidden, i.e. when I have an element like this: <span id="someId-ajax-loader" class="xwiki-livetable-loader hidden"> ? I'm asking because LiveTableElement currently has a very hackish way to determine if the livetable has been loaded.  
11:24 <+jvelociter> hmm I don't really recall when is "xwiki-livetable-loader" class removed, at the beginning or end of the loading entries process  
11:24 <+mflorea> ok. thanks,  then I'll take a look over the code  
11:39 <abusenius> has quit  
12:09 <vmassol> fyi rendering is now depending only on commons modules  
12:09 <vmassol> (and thus can be released - after commons is released)  
12:14 <vmassol> 39s to build commons, that's cool
